core_memory.medical_summary: Mid-50s, Type 2 Diabetes, hypertension(family history), osteoarthritis(knees/hands, weather pain), hypothyroidism(early 40s, med/regular check-ups), gallbladder removal(gallstones, attack, no fried foods), physical therapy, glucosamine, ergonomic adjustments, winter exercise challenges

archival_memory.user_health_overview: Oh, hey! Yeah, I’ve had my fair share of health ups and downs over the years. Being in my mid-50s now, I feel like I’ve seen it all—surgeries, medications, chronic conditions, you name it. But overall, I try to stay on top of my health as much as I can. Living in Kansas, where the winters can be rough, I have to be extra careful with joint pain and seasonal illnesses. It’s a bit surreal to think about how my health has changed over time; when I was younger, I barely thought about doctor visits, but now it feels like managing my health is almost a part-time job!
archival_memory.diabetes_diagnosis_details: Diagnosed 10 years ago with Type 2 Diabetes, required diet overhaul(no sugary snacks, carb monitoring), lifestyle changes(increased physical activity), regular blood sugar monitoring, 30-minute post-dinner walks significantly impact glucose stability, doctor guidance
archival_memory.hypertension_management: Hypertension managed via medication and lifestyle(stress management, walking/yoga). Winter exercise adapted(indoor workouts/treadmill). ER visit due to severe spike
archival_memory.osteoarthritis_details: Osteoarthritis in knees/hands worsens with weather changes; managed via physical therapy, glucosamine supplements, ergonomic chairs, supportive footwear, and activity modification
archival_memory.hypothyroidism_details: Hypothyroidism diagnosed early 40s; symptoms: exhaustion, weight gain. Initially thought aging, but tests revealed thyroid issues. Managed via medication and regular doctor check-ups
archival_memory.hypothyroidism_management: Hypothyroidism diagnosed early 40s; symptoms: exhaustion, weight gain. Initially thought aging, but tests revealed thyroid issues. Managed via medication and regular doctor check-ups
archival_memory.gallbladder_surgery_details: Gallbladder removal for gallstones; severe attack required surgery. Post-op digestion changes; avoid fried foods. Recovery manageable with dietary adjustments. Gallbladder impact on digestion noted
archival_memory.seasonal_allergies_details: Seasonal allergies flare up every spring due to Kansas pollen; managed with avoidance and medication
archival_memory.pneumonia_history: Pneumonia infection a couple years ago required extended recovery; now prioritizes flu/pneumonia vaccines to prevent infections
